thread.title: Marcus Morris has tip-in at the buzzer to lead Pistons over the Wizards
thread.title_full: Marcus Morris has tip-in at the buzzer to lead Pistons over the Wizards

author: Whitney Medworth
title: Marcus Morris has tip-in at the buzzer to lead Pistons over the Wizards
text:
The Pistons gave up a 16-point lead but held on for the win
The Detroit Pistons were in control of this game for the first three quarters until the Washington Wizards went on a 24-9 run in the fourth quarter to bring them within one. The entire comeback took place with John Wall and Bradley Beal on the bench as the Pistons watch their let their lead slip away. The Wizards finally reclaimed the lead with 2:14 remaining in the game. With 28 seconds to go, John Wall missed a layup at the basket, which gave the Pistons the ball for one final possession and a chance to win. The Pistons got three shots at the basket on their last possession, with the Wizards unable to get a defensive rebound, including the game-winning tip-in from Marcus Morris. 
GAME. WINNER. #PistonsNow #DetroitBasketball pic.twitter.com/xn9LsQYOHG 
— Detroit Pistons (@DetroitPistons) January 22, 2017 It was a heck of a night for the Morris twins. Both Markieff and Marcus led their respective teams in scoring and rebounds. The box scores on ESPN look like a glitch but they are in fact correct.
Also, Happy #NationalHuggingDay.
#NationalHuggingDay pic.twitter.com/hmKALMJ8ua 
— Detroit Pistons (@DetroitPistons) January 22, 2017
